verses.text: (א) I will praise \add thee\add*, O \sc Lord\sc*, with my whole heart; I will shew forth all thy marvellous works.
I will be glad and rejoice in thee: I will sing \add praise\add* to thy name, O thou most High.
(ב) When mine enemies are turned back, They shall fall and perish at thy presence.
For thou hast maintained my right and my cause; Thou satest in the throne judging right.
(ג) Thou hast rebuked the heathen, thou hast destroyed the wicked, Thou hast put out their name for ever and ever.
(ה) O thou enemy, destructions are come to a perpetual end: And thou hast destroyed cities; Their memorial is perished \add with\add* them.
(ו) But the \sc Lord\sc* shall endure for ever: He hath prepared his throne for judgment.
And he shall judge the world in righteousness, He shall minister judgment to the people in uprightness.
The \sc Lord\sc* also will be a refuge for the oppressed, A refuge in times of trouble.
And they that know thy name will put their trust in thee: For thou, \sc Lord\sc*, hast not forsaken them that seek thee.
(ז) Sing \add praises\add* to the \sc Lord\sc*, which dwelleth in Zion: Declare among the people his doings.
When he maketh inquisition for blood, he remembereth them: He forgetteth not the cry of the humble.
(ח) Have mercy upon me, O \sc Lord\sc*; Consider my trouble \add which I suffer\add* of them that hate me, Thou that liftest me up from the gates of death:
That I may shew forth all thy praise In the gates of the daughter of Zion: I will rejoice in thy salvation.
(ט) The heathen are sunk down in the pit \add that\add* they made: In the net which they hid is their own foot taken.
The \sc Lord\sc* is known \add by\add* the judgment \add which\add* he executeth: The wicked is snared in the work of his own hands. Higgaion. Selah.
(י) The wicked shall be turned into hell, \add And\add* all the nations that forget God.
(כ) For the needy shall not alway be forgotten: The expectation of the poor shall \add not\add* perish for ever.
Arise, O \sc Lord\sc*; let not man prevail: Let the heathen be judged in thy sight.
Put them in fear, O \sc Lord\sc*: \add That\add* the nations may know themselves \add to be but\add* men. Selah.
